PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Also please request a review if you remove `awaiting-author` much after the last commit. Else I won't get notified that the PR is ready for review again and it will slip through the cracks!

```suggestion
If M is a scalar multiple of a doubly stochastic matrix, then it is a conical combination of
```

```suggestion
lemma exists_eq_sum_perm_of_mem_doublyStochastic (hM : M âˆˆ doublyStochastic R n) :
```

```suggestion
theorem doublyStochastic_eq_convexHull_permMatrix :
```

```suggestion
  of the permutation matrices.

## TODO

Show that the extreme points of the doubly stochastic matrices are the permutation matrices
```

This is a no-op
```suggestion
open Finset Function Matrix
```

```suggestion
open Finset Function Matrix
```

```suggestion
lemma mem_doublyStochastic :
```

```suggestion
lemma exists_mem_doublyStochastic_eq_smul_iff {M : Matrix n n R} {s : R} (hs : 0 â‰¤ s) :
```

(row or column) stochastic matrices show up plenty too, and they are themselves submonoids. I realize that it's not relevant for Birkhoff's theorem, but maybe we should define those too, and have `doublyStochastic` be the `\inf` of them. This is not a strong preference, just a suggestion.
Yeah I considered this, but I don't know enough about what they're useful for to make the API for them. I'll leave a TODO for this?

of course, with proper notation instead
```suggestion
+ Show that the extreme points of doubly stochastic matrices are the permutation matrices.
+ Show that for `x y : n \to R`, `x` is majorized by `y` if and only if there is a doubly stochastic matrix `M` for which `M *\_v y = x`
```

```suggestion
    Â· gcongr with i hi
      exact subset_biUnion_of_mem f hi
```
or something similar should work (modulo merging master)

Unfortunately it's not quite this simple, the positivity part needs to be handled too. You end up with something like this:
```
    Â· gcongr with i hi
      Â· simp [*]
      Â· exact subset_biUnion_of_mem f hi
```
which is quite a bit less clear in my view.
Let's keep this unresolved in case @hrmacbeth has thoughts

I _think_ the problem here is one of the following
- positivity can't intro in the goal
- positivity can't specialize a forall in a hypothesis
- positivity can't see the left part of a conjunction in the hypotheses

I'm not sure which of those are actually true, but any one of them would make `positivity` be weaker than desirable here. All that said, I do still think the original proof is more readable than a gcongr proof, at least unless the gcongr is qualified.
Similarly here
Same as above, using `gcongr` here gives you a three line proof instead of the clean one-line proof.

```suggestion
lemma nonneg_of_mem_doublyStochastic (hM : M âˆˆ doublyStochastic R n) (i j : n) : 0 â‰¤ M i j :=
```

```suggestion
lemma sum_row_of_mem_doublyStochastic (hM : M âˆˆ doublyStochastic R n) (i : n) : âˆ‘ j, M i j = 1 :=
```
Same
Same
Same
Same
